definition:
The *Bernstein polynomials* of $n$ are defined by
$$B_{i}^{n}(t)={n\choose i}t^i (1-t)^{n-i} \quad\quad i=0,1,2,\dots,n$$
where ${n\choose i}$ is the binomial coefficient.

![image](bp)

Bernstein polynomials are used extensively in interpolation theory and
in computer graphics. They can be computed efficiently using the de
Casteljau’s algorithm.
